comments_since_last_sample.body: Pink Floyd "Is There Anybody Out There" from The Wall is an instrumental track but it has the vibe you describe. Delicate melody over dark chords. The very sound of anguish over the gradual erosion of empathy and humanity. Helps that the album follows essentially the same emotional arc.

Several songs come to mind from NIN’s “The Downward Spiral” ... [The Becoming](https://youtu.be/9TLHToPm71U), [Eraser](https://youtu.be/Ldl98PaHNC0), [The Downward Spiral](https://youtu.be/9FNe7l3KkQU) ...

... so many NIN songs could work ... like [Right Where It Belongs](https://youtu.be/F-jZHMX-CJ0)
Welcome to the jungle - guns 'n' roses

People ain't no good - Nick Cave 
r the entire Murder Ballads album by him and the bad seeds

Entire Nebraska album by Bruce Springsteen
I haven’t seen squid game but, Radiohead?

Dance with the Devil by Immortal Technique. 
I do not recommend you listen to this song. It is dark.

Sad but True by Metallica

Gunship has a song called Fly for your Life. check out the music video to that. 

Handlbars by Flobots is you wanna abstract your request to humanity.
